page.title: 04EDGEFIELD CHURCH IN 1985
page.content: Last year the Church celebrated the centenary of being rebuilt on its present site by installing on the south side a new stained glass window designed by John Hayward.It depicts St Peter and St Paul, the old tower and the present church, a typical scene of ploughing and seagulls, and a charming roundel showing Canon Marcon on his bicycle. More examples of modern stained glass are in the porch -four delightful small windows dated 1981. There is no longer a Rector: the Rectory has been sold & the Rector of Holt is now also Rector of Edgefield. On alternate Sundays there is Holy Communion in the morning or Evensong in the afternoon, and there is a regular weekday Communion service.An unusual feature is the Sunday School, because it takes place on Tuesdays.
